newsitem.title: UK: FTSE 100 closes above 3,900, sets new record high.
newsitem.headline: FTSE 100 closes above 3,900, sets new record high.

text.p: London shares finished the week as they began, setting new record highs, after the Bundesbank's decision to ease monetary policy triggered cuts in interest rates across Europe on Thursday, traders said.

Stronger-than-expected U.S. data briefly took the shine off London's early performance, but the British market recovered later to take the FTSE 100 index of leading shares to a record close of 3,907.5, a rise of 16.4 points on the day.

An overnight 43-point rise on Wall Street added to the upward pressure on UK shares ahead of the long holiday weekend, and the index advanced swiftly through 3,900 points for the first time to hit a new trading peak of 3,911.6 shortly after the opening.
The record close on the FTSE index outdid its previous best of 3,891.1 set on Thursday.
